Description: Funerary papyrus of Tasheretenkhons Gepor containing original text adapted from the First Book of Breathing written in hieratic script verso and recto. A single line of Greek is written on the verso.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Egypt, Thebes. Found with P. BM EA 10124 probably inside the coffin (now lost) of Senchonsis in the collective tomb of the archon Soter (see Herbin 2008, 132).
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Herbin, F.-R., Books of Breathing and Related Texts (Catalogue of the Books of the Dead and Other Related Texts in the British Museum IV), London, 2008, pp. 132-134, pls. 104-107.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (246)
Herbin 2008 / Books of Breathing and Related Texts (pp.132-134, pls.104-107)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (57790) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/57790)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Backed: brown paper (lifted) Cleaned Tabbed: japanese paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape Binding: copydex self adhesive carpet tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: fair
